properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Westerly winds will reach nearly 90 kilometres per hour until this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are possible beginning Saturday morning. Strong northerly winds are forecast to impact Naujaat beginning Saturday morning. These winds may cause significantly reduced visibilities in blowing snow Saturday morning and persisting through to Sunday. Please stay alert for updated bulletins and check local public forecasts for more information on timing and strength of winds. As the event draws nearer, this watch may be upgraded to a blizzard warning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-13T01:19:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T09:20:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2545460047.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A Pacific front will remain nearly stationary across the North Coast and Haida Gwaii today and tonight. Heavy precipitation and strong winds will accompany this storm. Haida Gwaii will receive 2 cm of snow this afternoon followed by 5 to 10 cm tonight. The coastal sections of the North Coast will see a mix of rain and snow this afternoon. Snowfall will accumulate mostly during the evening hours with 5 cm expected before changing to heavy rain. The inland sections of the North Coast including Terrace, Kitimat and surrounding areas will see snow today and this evening. Snow amounts will vary between 5 to 15 cm across the region before changing to rain this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-13T05:13:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T13:14:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3978202078.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - coastal sections, North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Brief but intense snowfall will continue this morning and early this afternoon. An intense band of snow is currently moving eastward across the area. Visibilities will be rapidly reduced in heavy snow and blowing snow. Snow may accumulate rapidly on roads making travel hazardous. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Snow squall warnings are issued when brief but intense bursts of heavy snow will produce near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T22:59:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T16:02:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1404511688.2021

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR GOLDEN (March 12, 2021 09:00 - Cranbrook) The Ministry of Environment & Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Interior Health Authority has issued a Dust Advisory for Golden because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes; respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-landwater/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-03-13T09:34:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2021-03-12T17:35:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2409309486.2021
Area: East Columbia

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 30 cm by Saturday morning. Maximum wind gusts today: easterly up to 60 km/h . Maximum wind gusts tonight: northerly up to 80 km/h. Locations: Nain to Makkovik. Time span: continuing into Saturday. Remarks: Snow and blowing snow will persist into Saturday. Near-zero visibilities in white-out conditions are expected at times. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-13T06:47:52-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. A slow moving weather system will bring wet snow today, and tonight for the Kitimat area. The wet snow will change to rain this evening when warmer air enters the region. 15 to 20 cm of snow is expected by this evening. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-13T08:39:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T16:40:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1523931787.2021
Area: North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total snowfall: 5 to 10 cm on Saturday with further amounts expected Saturday night. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h. Locations: Rigolet to Black Tickle. Time span: Saturday morning until overnight Sunday. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strengthening northwesterly winds on Saturday to produce poor visibility in blowing snow. While strong winds will continue on Monday, the snow will taper off overnight Sunday night. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-13T06:50:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T14:51:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3679425091.2021
Area: Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A slow moving weather system will generate significant southeast winds along the exposed coastal sections of the Central Coast for today, tonight and Saturday. Wind speeds of 70 to 90 km/h from the southeast. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

Area: Central Coast - coastal sections

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A slow moving weather system will bring snow today, tonight and Saturday morning for Stewart and surrounding areas. The snow will be heaviest for tonight and Saturday morning before changing to rain midday Saturday. Up to 35 cm of snow will fall during this time. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Total snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 centimetres are expected by this evening. The snow combined with moderate winds will cause blowing snow which will significantly reduce visibilities. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls could locally reduce visibilities to zero today. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for brief but intense bursts of heavy snow producing near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-13T07:27:21-00:00
